>

So much of this! 

 I hope they release a mini patch to add clamshells. We don't want to wait months for another patch..

> 
> ...
> And "better" is subjective. You think it's horrifically worse. I think it's different and would prefer clamshells, but will happily use the stock fairings and be happy to check yet another must-install mod off the list.

Finally someone who understands.

I'll happily 'aye' both of those things. I just hope the first patch also has dV readouts.

> 
> Seriously? I can't believe this. How could they screw up something so easy?

Did you guys see the limit on how long each fairing segement is? It's ridiculous! Even if they couldn't fuse the segments together, at least let them be longer than **one meter!** :mad

Almost as disappointing was the Flea booster, which is *another* 1.25m SRB instead of a much more useful 0.625m one. They also decided to nerf the already useless RT-10. Why SQUAD?

You don't seem to be contributing anything to this thread, besides minimizing people's opinions because you think it's unimportant.

>

I approve this posting. Thank you very much. Also: "nay" to overreacting and drama from the usual suspects.

I am pretty sure that there will be some different styles to chose from in relatively short time. Give them a break, seriously.

> 
> Nobody's shown how the fairings work interstage

Not in detail, but someone (Das?) did how basically how it would work. In addition to closing a fairing in a point at the top, you can close it on the outside of a part, so it can work as an interstage fairing, it's just the minor details we don't know.

> 
> I second this motion. All in favor say 'aye', all against say 'nay'.

Nay!!! I am a horse!

Jokes, but seriously I like the explosion fairings. I hope they add the option to switch between. Then every one can be happy. =)

>

Aye Aye
I'd prefer clamshell separation, but I'll live with confetti to get the ability to work inside a fairing after it's installed (that is seriously slick).

Harv did confirm these are planned features. It's mainly down to time and priority I think. As it's impossible to do everything at the same time. I'm sure the team will revisit this aspect after 1.0 launch. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

This, precisely. Add my 'nay' vote.

Honestly, if SQUAD were to prove they could walk on water in July, there are those who would criticise them for not being able to swim. Lighten up.

> 
> This, precisely. Add my 'nay' vote.
> Honestly, if SQUAD were to prove they could walk on water in July, there are those who would criticise them for not being able to swim. Lighten up.

Honestly, I think many of the communities concerns are justified.
Its alright. Let Squad have their confetti. Its good to know that procedural fairings will still have a place here and wont be going anywhere. Especially now.

Given the fact that they're non-persistent debris, having a fairing explode in ten million pieces is less of a concern at this point. As Red Iron Crown pointed out, the benefits of the stock fairings will outweigh the less-than-desired separation for me; and as 5th horseman said, it means one mod less I need to worry about. It'll be nice to have clamshell separation but given what, based on the 1.0 videos, is offered right now, I'll be more than happy with it.
Did anyone mention how ridiculously heavy the fairings are? a small 1.25m fairing weighs ONE TONNE. Fairings are meant to be as light as possible, not made of solid lead.

After seeing stock fairings in the preview videos, I think I would continue to use Procedural Fairings mod instead.

First of all, stock fairings look stupid when they explode like a frag grenade.

Second, while I understand the decision of making them non-persistent debris, I still don't like it. ProcFairings require you to be careful with separation - or you may end up with too many debris. I've actually had several close calls with some fairing debris that were separated too late; I like such things.

> 
> Did anyone mention how ridiculously heavy the fairings are? a small 1.25m fairing weighs ONE TONNE. Fairings are meant to be as light as possible, not made of solid lead.

After watching some streams I've noticed that crafts acceleration doesn't increase at all when they've jettisoned, even on tiny craft with huge fairings. I think that the weight is on the base part so jettisoning the fairing doesn't reduce the mass.

I hope I'm mistaken though...

> 
> Did anyone mention how ridiculously heavy the fairings are? a small 1.25m fairing weighs ONE TONNE. Fairings are meant to be as light as possible, not made of solid lead.

That does seem a bit excessive. The Atlas V 401 has a payload fairing mass of between 2-2.5t, and that's at a 4m diameter.

[http://www.spaceflight101.com/atlas-v-401.html](http://www.spaceflight101.com/atlas-v-401.html)
